summary:
4. Urges confidence-building measures, including military measures and opening of crossing points.

5. Welcomes efforts to accommodate Committee on Missing Persons.

6. Reaffirms relevant resolutions, particularly 1251 (1999).

7. Extends UNFICYP's mandate until 31 January 2014.

8. Calls on both sides to engage with UNFICYP on buffer zone demarcation.

9. Calls on Turkish Cypriot side and Turkish forces to restore Strovilia's military status quo.

10. Calls for access to deminers and removal of mines.

11. Requests a report on resolution implementation by 10 January 2014.

12. Welcomes efforts to implement zero-tolerance policy on sexual exploitation and abuse.

13. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
